title: Milton Keynes 'murder': Two teenage boys stabbed to death at birthday party named
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Two teenage boys who were stabbed to death at a house party in Milton Keynes have been named.

The victims have been named locally as 17-year-olds Ben Gillham-Rice and Dominic Ansah.

Police have opened a double murder probe following the killings and have appealed to the public to come forward with information.

The deceased are believed to have been at a house party with up to 20 other people when the attack happened in the Emerson Valley area of the city shortly before midnight.

One teenager died at the scene, while another died in hospital as a result of his injuries.

Two other males were also rushed to hospital in a serious condition but their injuries are not believed to be life-threatening.

Police believe the people involved in the incident were all known to each other.

Did you see what happened? Email webnews@mirror.co.uk

(Image: Vagner Vidal/Hyde News & Picture)

(Image: Vagner Vidal/Hyde News & Picture)

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

Chilling photos from the scene showed blood smeared on the front door of the house situated on a quiet cul-de-sac in Archford Croft.

Detective Chief Superintendent Ian Hunter said: "Two other males, one aged 17 and one aged 23, were also injured as a result of this incident which occurred at a private house party at the address.

"Clearly, this is a dreadful incident, and we are in the very early stages of the investigation."

The scene is currently cordoned off as forensic officers gather evidence.

Mr Hunter said the crime scene at the address "is likely to remain for several days".

Recognising the "concern" in the community after the incident, Mr Hunter added: "I believe the people directly involved in this incident are all likely to have known each other."

(Image: Vagner Vidal/Hyde News & Pictures Ltd)

(Image: Vagner Vidal/Hyde News & Pictures Ltd)

Tributes have flooded in on social media as news filtered through of the boy's deaths.

One friend wrote on Facebook: "Growing up from so young together, holidays and building memories. I cannot believe you’re gone, you was a special boy."

Another said: "Shocking and very sad news, a young lad with his whole life ahead of him. Really hope he and his family get some justice!!!"

Two tearful cousins of Dom Ansah laid flowers at the scene on Sunday afternoon.

One of the cousins, who did not wish to give her name, said: "He's come here with his long-time best friend since childhood, comes to a party and both of their lives just got ripped away from them.

"He was just so respectful to like his family and friends.

"Many, many people's hearts are broken."

A neighbour told Mirror Online: "I did hear a commotion but I thought it was someone leaving a party.

"There was a party going on there."

And another said: "I did hear a lot of shouting and then an ambulance came.

(Image: south bedsnews agency_sbna_fairl)

(Image: Cliff Hide/LNP)

"It's usually really safe here, we were shocked when we saw what had happened."

A man, in his 30s, who called 999, said: "It is really unusual in this road to hear any noise in the evening so when I heard what sounded like a serious altercation taking place, I decided to call the police immediately.

"The police and ambulances were here within minutes of my call and I saw a couple of dozen young people coming out of the house as the police went in.

"It was a very unusual scene for this place which is normally so quiet."

He said there have previously been regular house parties at the same address, but he was not aware of any trouble there.

One person who lives nearby said: "Soon after midnight loads of police cars and ambulances arrived in the road and there were blue lights everywhere."

A woman, who asked not to be identified, said: "Various people were coming to the house where there was a 'Happy Birthday' banner draped above the front door.

(Image: Cliff Hide/LNP)

"I saw a young girl get out of a taxi and go into the house early on in the evening and by 11pm there was lots of music coming from inside.

"That in itself was unusual because this place is normally very quiet, even on a weekend evening."

No arrests have been made by police.

Earlier it was understood the party had been 'gatecrashed' by other attendees, but this is no longer believed to be the case.

Head of Crime Detective Chief Superintendent Ian Hunter said: “Thames Valley Police is in the early stages of a double murder investigation after two teenage boys have tragically died in this shocking incident.

“Our priorities at this time are to conduct a thorough investigation and to support those who have been affected.

"Officers are currently at the scene which has been cordoned off and members of the public are asked to avoid the area."

The MP for Milton Keynes South said he was shocked and that he would be speaking to police.

Iain Stewart wrote on Twitter: "I offer my deepest condolences to the families affected and am available to offer them assistance."
description: Ben Gillham-Rice and Dominic Ansah, both 17, died and two other males were taken to hospital in a serious condition
